item.name: Acquire
item.comment: Wow, this classic really shined for me. Luck, strategy, and trying to garner insider information make for a great game in my book.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
The cards turn what would be a rather lame euro into something fantastic. However, the family game with all the wooden meeple upgrades also serves to wow the agrarian rooted people that I call family and makes for a descent evening.
I'd play the full game anytime.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: Had to get it for parties. I hate playing this game.

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: I really didn't see the strategy in this game in one play. So, my rating is probably unfair. I'll try to play again with three people and revise.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: Absolutely amazing game if you play with the right people. Cube pusher snoots will likely hate it. You must house rule this game to your liking. Played several times with my brother for some good bonding.

item.name: At the Gates of Loyang
item.comment: I can't give this a 7 as I would definitely have to be in the right mood to play it again. I did enjoy it and would recommend that people try it. Owning is a different story. Our first four player game took 240 minutes.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: If I had to keep just two two player games, Battle Line and Hive would be it.
item.wishlistcomment:
Ancient Card Game Deduction
Mechanic Hand Management Set Collection
2 100%

item.name: Battleball
item.comment: Play with the advanced rules and it's really quite a bit of fun. However, my "toy" phase with games went pretty quickly.

2 100%

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: Wife and I love playing this, but Blokus duo has replaced it.

item.name: Blokus Duo
item.comment: Love travel blokus over the original for two people. Perfectly good time.

item.name: Boggle
item.comment: Fun filler. I'll always have boggle. Old version is better with more challenging mix of cubes. Plus, I get rich thrifting big boggles.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: I'm not sure I get the game, but all the people around me loved it. I must be daft. However, I'll rate it high since it pleased my friends and family.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: My favorite press your luck.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: I have a love hate relationship with this game. I first purchased it in 2004 and tried to get everyone to play. It wasn't until 5 years later did I expand my board game collection. I blame the crappy user interface of BGG and the bland themes of eurogames that confused me.

item.comment: Don't need Caylus if you have this.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: I love this game so much with non-gamers. Fantastic interaction. Non-gamers are totally wowed by this game.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment: This is my first real "dudes in a corridor." Earth Reborn might count for some maps. I liked it quite a bit. The play time was perfect for what it was. I wasn't too happy with the tile draws as there weren't enough openings for the demon player.

item.name: Clue
item.comment: From the days before BGG.

item.name: DaVinci's Challenge
item.comment: Excellent 20 minute game with little instruction needed. A little annoying to have to use the reference sheet though. Probably would change if played more frequently.

item.name: Dawn Under
item.comment: One of my kids games I'll actually put in my collection. Fantastic memory game that adults can enjoy. It's memory with a little fear and excitement!

item.name: Dirty Minds: The Game of Naughty Clues
Dragonland
item.comment: A really gem of a game! I had fun playing and is fun little mechanic with no wooden cubes!

item.name: Enchanted Forest
item.comment: Two copies. 1982 and 1994.1994 is missing instructions.

item.name: Frog Juice
item.comment: I'm going to try two decks together. It wasn't bad. However, we really don't need this game.

item.name: The Game of Life: Pirates of the Caribbean – Dead Man's Chest
Ghosts!
item.comment: Thrift find in the 2 player filler category that I'm way overweight on at the moment.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: So accessible and lots of fun. I play to cut my opponents off, not to chase fish.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: Lots of fun, but I'm a little overwhelmed with filler two players at the moment. This will definitely be one that I keep.

item.name: I'm the Boss!
item.comment: Played a couple of times at the beach and will bring it again. I thought it would be a little more fun, but that's probably because of my family being slightly confused about gaming.

item.name: Labyrinth
item.comment: I'm not going to go crazy for it, but the wife loves this game.

item.name: Liar's Dice
item.comment: Awesome filler with ease of play. Sometimes can be a little predictable with new people.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: Ok, I prefer battleline. This game annoys me, but now my wife likes. it.

item.name: The Lost World Jurassic Park Game
Master Labyrinth
item.comment: Just as fun as the original, but a little different. Have two copies

item.name: Medici vs Strozzi
item.comment: A really confusing brain burner for me. However, it will probably climb in my rating (or it will go out the door!).

item.name: Monsters Menace America
item.comment: I'm thinking about getting rid of this game. I'll give it another couple of plays.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment: I love Mr. Jack because it is a brain burner. I love trying not to lose as Jack. I don't like playing with the investigator side too much.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: Yes, it's a little simple and nearly all about offense, but damn is it fun!
item.wantpartslist: I need a yellow army reference card. Thanks!

item.comment: Really enjoyed pandemic for what it was. It's definitely lighter fare and introductory, but it also doesn't feel boring.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: Everyone else owns a freaking copy. Have only been able to play once. Need to increase this.

item.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Mojo Jojo Attacks Townsville Game
The Powerpuff Girls: Saving the World Before Bedtime
The Powerpuff Girls: Villains at Large Game
item.comment: Excellent filler, but may wear out its welcome quickly. I always find that our scores are 20 to 21 or really close to that. So, it probably has to do with the luck of the draw.

item.name: Quoridor
item.comment: Great abstract. Has a lot of potential if I had more time to play.

item.comment: Fantastic complexity for what it is. Lots of strategy and conflict.

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment: I like to cheat with the dictionary, but still entertaining when you really think beyond the words and try to maximize points and manage tiles.

item.name: Sharp Shooters
item.comment: Everyone loves this game. I enjoy it as well, but not to the extreme that others do. I prefer can't stop. However, this plays faster.

item.name: Sorry!
item.comment: Sorry! is excellent for a social quick game or just something to fill the time while dinner is in the oven. So, so easy.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment: For non-gamer friends, they want to play this over any other game. Hasbro is onto something.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment:
Definitely not a game to play with gamers and "game night". However, perfect for small party setting. Cut down the point level by 6 points for every additional player beyond three. Use teams if possible.
Our first three player game was 2.5 hours. A tad long for what it was. We played to 20.

item.name: Teams of Enemies
item.comment: Great game for people born between 1940 and 1975. I think it won't fly for people outside of that.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: What a freaking jaw droppingly awesome game.

item.name: Time's Up! Deluxe
item.comment: Awesome game for 4 people. A little less so with six, but a whole lot of fun regardless.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: 90's Time Capsule Edition
item.comment: It's ok and works for a certain crowd, but not the greatest edition. I really don't like the way the cards are set aside by year.

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment: A good bait game or some mindless gaming when you really, really want to play a game just to play a game. I think I hate the game because my wife suggests it just chalk up more "I played a game with you" points.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: So excited to play; it was a craigslist find for $45.

item.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle
item.comment: My God did I love this in the 90s. Unfortunately, I doubt I'll ever play it again. I still have a couple thousand cards laying around.

item.name: Wasabi!
item.comment: I just didn't like this as much as I thought I would several months ago.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: Had a good time with a large group. Would definitely recommend if it fits in the spirit of the party.

item.name: The Wizard of Oz Game
item.comment: Kids' Collection
